text:
Jk

Anyway I‚Äôm muting this now lmao

But do rest assured that I‚Äôm probably thoroughly impressed with your response and I‚Äôm sure you really showed me!
My favourites are the ones who keep asking is CBT means cock and ball torture and honestly with all the ball busting some of you are doing in my mentions, I‚Äôm not even sure anymore‚Äî
(This oversimplification was deliberate because at this point there‚Äôs so much outrage in my mentions I just can‚Äôt possibly take it seriously lmao)

‚ÄúWhen my boss treats me like I‚Äôm worthless, I feel worthless‚Äù

‚ÄúSounds like a you problem, he was probably just having a bad day‚Äù

‚Äî>no depression

Friends.... I know what CBT is.

This was a shit post.

My criticism is directed at the folk who leapt at this as an opportunity to double down on toxic positivity & subsequently accuse anyone who disagrees of either being ‚Äútoo lazy to do the work‚Äù or too simple to understand it.
Idk man maybe just meme or move on

Like, the whole point of this post was just to meme about how hilariously simple this diagram was because roasting terrible textbook diagrams is fun.

But some of you are in my mentions wholeheartedly explaining this shit to me with some pretty alarming takes

If you are unwilling to (or uninterested in) even ATTEMPTING to understand inequitable distributions of power and the ways in which factors related to THAT impact our mental and physical well being, do literally everyone a favour and don‚Äôt become a therapist.

Being yelled at and demeaned by your boss can further reinforce feelings of helplessness ROOTED IN THE REALITY of being TRAPPED FINANCIALLY. 
It‚Äôs not just about being yelled at & responding to that one single situation.

Acting like our emotional states can be separated from our material conditions is ridiculous, in and of itself.

Someone with the financial power to get up and leave when their boss yells or lashes out at them is NOT in the same position as someone who is forced to just take it.
Teaching a target of abuse to just take the abuse better is surprisingly not as helpful as you may think it is.

Feeling worthless as a result of abuse (and yes I‚Äôm calling it abuse because of the glaring power imbalance at play, and a lucky guess that this isn‚Äôt the first or last time someone‚Äôs shitty boss is yelling at them) cannot and should not be reduced to maladaptive behaviour.

Okay for folk who don‚Äôt get why this is wrong‚Äîthere are too many reasons to get into in-depth, but just a glaring one:

Your boss (who has full power over your livelihood) treating you like an emotional punching bag is inexcusable.

You know in video games, where you choose your dialogue and it‚Äôll lead to different results?

A bird shat on your car.

Choose your dialogue:

‚ÄúBirds hate me‚Äù ‚Äî> depression

‚ÄúBirds are inconsiderate pricks‚Äù ‚Äî> no depression
My neurotransmitters would like a word
Ravioli Ravioli Give Me the Formuoli
Psychology textbook diagrams never cease to amaze me https://t.co/C4P6jYx0jv
